body:
i’m closing this issue because it has been inactive for a few months. this probably means that the issue is not reproducible or it has been fixed in a newer version.

please reopen if you still encounter this issue with the [latest stable version](http://owncloud.org/install/) (currently owncloud 5.0.9) and then please use the [issue template](https://raw.github.com/owncloud/core/master/issue_template.md). you an also contribute directly by providing a patch – see the [developer manual](http://doc.owncloud.org/server/5.0/developer_manual/). :)

thank you!

hi,
this issue is also affecting me. i installed owncloud from debian's repositories. the version i'm using is 5.0.10+dfsg-1.

here's some more info:

### expected behaviour
i would expect that, while a user is downloading a file from "files", he could also browse through any other location within owncloud. downloading multiple files from "files" should also be possible.

### actual behaviour
as soon as a user starts downloading a file, he can't download anything else simultaneously, or browse anywhere else. browsing and downloading is possible if another browser is opened, or a browser on another computer is used.
simultaneously browsing anywhere else on the same server (outside owncloud) is possible.

### steps to reproduce
1. upload a file with the "files" app. it will help if this is a big file, and downloading it takes some time.
2. after the upload is complete, start downloading it.
3. click anywhere around owncloud with the same browser. the pages will be "waiting..." for response.

this happens both when the site is accessed through https and plain http.

### server configuration
operating system: debian gnu/linux 7.1

web server: apache, version: 2.2.22-13, installed from debian's repositories.

database: mysql, version: 5.5.31+dfsg-0+wheezy1, from debian's repositories.

php version: 5.4.4-14+deb7u4, from debian's repositories.

owncloud version: 5.4.4-14+deb7u4

### client configuration
browser: any. tested with iceweasel, chrome, firefox, internet explorer.

operating system:  both linux and windows.

### logs
#### web server error log
nothing relevant at /var/log/apache2/error.log

/var/log/apache2/access.log:

```
192.168.2.116 - - [17/sep/2013:22:19:42 +0100] "get /owncloud/ http/1.1" 301 572 "-" "mozilla/5.0 (x11; linux i686; rv:17.0) gecko/20130811 firefox/17.0 iceweasel/17.0.8"
```

/var/log/apache2/ssl_access.log
(session ids stripped out)


not sure what to include here. see the description.


thanks and best regards,
pitxyoki

i'll copy here my comment from #4904 , as it's a duplicate:


now, this is funny.
while the download was going, i clicked the "media" app. expectedly, nothing happened.
however, after the download finished, this ended up on the apache ssl_acces.log:

```
192.168.2.116 - - [18/sep/2013:20:47:29 +0100] "get /owncloud/index.php/apps/files/ajax/scan.php?force=false&dir=&requesttoken=e3827e7fcb862241f97b http/1.1" 200 903 "-" "mozilla/5.0 (x11; linux i686; rv:17.0) gecko/20130811 firefox/17.0 iceweasel/17.0.8"
192.168.2.116 - - [18/sep/2013:21:08:25 +0100] "get / http/1.1" 200 2196 "-" "mozilla/5.0 (x11; linux i686; rv:17.0) gecko/20130811 firefox/17.0 iceweasel/17.0.8"
192.168.2.116 - - [18/sep/2013:21:08:30 +0100] "get /favicon.ico http/1.1" 404 628 "-" "mozilla/5.0 (x11; linux i686; rv:17.0) gecko/20130811 firefox/17.0 iceweasel/17.0.8"
192.168.2.116 - - [18/sep/2013:21:08:32 +0100] "get /favicon.ico http/1.1" 404 628 "-" "mozilla/5.0 (x11; linux i686; rv:17.0) gecko/20130811 firefox/17.0 iceweasel/17.0.8"
192.168.2.116 - - [18/sep/2013:20:54:29 +0100] "get /owncloud/index.php/apps/files/ajax/download.php?files=somefile.7z&dir=%2f http/1.1" 200 525482538 "-" "mozilla/5.0 (x11; linux i686; rv:17.0) gecko/20130811 firefox/17.0 iceweasel/17.0.8"
192.168.2.116 - - [18/sep/2013:20:55:00 +0100] "get /owncloud/index.php/apps/media http/1.1" 200 805 "-" "mozilla/5.0 (x11; linux i686; rv:17.0) gecko/20130811 firefox/17.0 iceweasel/17.0.8"
```

notice the dates, which are out of order. they were all printed only after the download was complete.

i have two ideas. can you check your apache config and increase the maxclients and serverlimit values in the prefork module?
do you use sqlite? it is possible that the sqlite db locks other php processes. please try with mysql and see if the problem still exists.
please reopen this issue if it still exists after this two changes.

thanks for the help, karlitschek. i still see the same thing happening.
i increased maxclients to 500, and set serverlimit to 500.
as stated on my report, i was already using mysql, exclusively by owncloud.

i can't reopen the issue because i did not create it.
still unable to simultaneous download using same browser.

this problem becomes even more annoying when accesing oc from behind a proxy: if you start a large download (a video mkv, for example), then abort the download, you still will not be able to browse any other location. this is probably because even though you have stopped the dl in the browser, the proxy is still completely downloading the file.
